back_cards.definition_en: A strong feeling of wanting something
back_cards.example_en: She felt a strong desire to travel the world.

back_cards.definition_en: A wish or longing for something specific
back_cards.example_en: His desire for a new car motivated him to save money.
Her desire to become a doctor drove her studies.

back_cards.definition_en: A craving for food or drink
back_cards.example_en: After hiking, he had a desire for ice-cold water.
Their desire for each other grew over time.

back_cards.definition_en: A direction or order to do something
back_cards.example_en: The teacher gave clear instructions for the assignment.

back_cards.definition_en: Guidance on how to use something
back_cards.example_en: The manual provides instructions for assembling the desk.
She received instruction in coding at the workshop.

back_cards.definition_en: A command in a process or system
back_cards.example_en: The recipe’s instructions were easy to follow.

back_cards.definition_en: Advice or guidance in a professional setting
back_cards.example_en: The manager’s instructions helped the team meet the deadline.

back_cards.definition_en: A sudden, serious situation requiring immediate action
back_cards.example_en: The hospital was ready for any emergency.
He called 911 during the medical emergency.

back_cards.definition_en: A natural disaster requiring urgent response
back_cards.example_en: The town evacuated due to the flood emergency.
The server crash was an IT emergency.

back_cards.definition_en: A critical situation in daily life
back_cards.example_en: A flat tire was an emergency on her way to work.

back_cards.definition_en: The process of using one’s mind to consider something
back_cards.example_en: Her thinking was clear during the debate.

back_cards.definition_en: A way of reasoning or problem-solving
back_cards.example_en: Creative thinking helped him solve the puzzle.
He spent the evening in deep thinking about his future.
Her thinking on the issue surprised her friends.

back_cards.definition_en: Mental focus in a work context
back_cards.example_en: Strategic thinking improved the company’s growth.

back_cards.definition_en: A trip or journey to explore a place
back_cards.example_en: They took a tour of the ancient ruins.

back_cards.definition_en: A guided visit to a specific location
back_cards.example_en: The museum offers a tour of its art collection.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of performances or events
back_cards.example_en: The band’s world tour sold out in hours.

back_cards.definition_en: A short trip to see something nearby
back_cards.example_en: We went on a tour of the local vineyard.

back_cards.definition_en: An exploration of a workplace or facility
back_cards.example_en: The factory tour showed how cars are made.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to the country of France
back_cards.example_en: She loves French culture and cuisine.
He speaks French fluently after years of study.
The French artist painted a stunning portrait.
This French wine is perfect for dinner.
Her French dress was elegant and chic.

back_cards.definition_en: To join or mix things together
back_cards.example_en: She combined flour and water to make dough.

back_cards.definition_en: To unite for a common purpose
back_cards.example_en: They combined their efforts to finish the project.
The chef combined spices for a unique dish.
He combined old and new designs for the house.

back_cards.definition_en: To merge in a technical process
back_cards.example_en: The machine combines parts to create a product.
The full moon lit up the night sky.

back_cards.definition_en: A symbol of beauty or mystery
back_cards.example_en: Her eyes sparkled like the moon.
The moon’s phases change every month.
They walked under the moon on the beach.

back_cards.definition_en: A reference in storytelling or culture
back_cards.example_en: The story mentioned a wolf howling at the moon.
She felt sad after hearing the news.
The movie’s ending was sad but touching.
The rainy day had a sad, quiet vibe.
It’s sad that the event was canceled.

back_cards.definition_en: Reflecting a lack of energy or joy
back_cards.example_en: His sad expression worried his friends.

back_cards.definition_en: The location of a building or place
back_cards.example_en: She wrote her new address on the form.
The president gave an address on TV.
Please share your email address with me.

back_cards.definition_en: A way to refer to someone formally
back_cards.example_en: Use ‘Doctor’ in the address for her letter.

back_cards.definition_en: A designation in a system or network
back_cards.example_en: The website’s address is easy to remember.

back_cards.definition_en: The twelfth month of the year
back_cards.example_en: December is cold in the northern hemisphere.

back_cards.definition_en: A time for holidays and celebrations
back_cards.example_en: We plan a big party every December.
Skiing is popular in December.

back_cards.definition_en: A month for reflection or planning
back_cards.example_en: She set new goals in December.
December brings our family together.
You can park anywhere on this street.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to emphasize no specific location
back_cards.example_en: I couldn’t find my keys anywhere.

back_cards.definition_en: In a flexible or open context
back_cards.example_en: With Wi-Fi, you can work anywhere.
She’s ready to travel anywhere this summer.
This shop has better deals than anywhere else.

back_cards.definition_en: A common farm bird raised for food
back_cards.example_en: The farmer keeps chickens for eggs.
She cooked chicken for dinner.

back_cards.definition_en: A dish or meal featuring chicken
back_cards.example_en: I ordered fried chicken at the restaurant.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for someone acting cowardly
back_cards.example_en: Don’t be a chicken; try the new ride!

back_cards.definition_en: A reference in rural or farm life
back_cards.example_en: The chicken roamed freely in the yard.

back_cards.definition_en: A substance used to produce energy
back_cards.example_en: The car runs on unleaded fuel.
The plane needed more fuel for the trip.
Her passion was the fuel for her success.

back_cards.definition_en: A material for heating or cooking
back_cards.example_en: We used wood as fuel for the campfire.

back_cards.definition_en: A topic or issue that sparks debate
back_cards.example_en: His comments added fuel to the argument.

back_cards.definition_en: A vehicle that travels on rails
back_cards.example_en: The train arrived at the station on time.

back_cards.definition_en: A series of connected events or thoughts
back_cards.example_en: Her train of thought was hard to follow.

back_cards.definition_en: A group of vehicles or animals
back_cards.example_en: The wagon train moved across the plains.
The supply train kept the project on track.
I take the train to work every day.
The organization fights against child abuse.
Abuse of power led to his resignation.
He faced verbal abuse during the argument.
Drug abuse is a serious health issue.
The team addressed workplace abuse concerns.
The construction of the bridge took years.
The new construction changed the city skyline.
He works in construction as an engineer.

back_cards.definition_en: The way something is put together
back_cards.example_en: The argument’s construction was logical.
Road construction caused traffic delays.

back_cards.definition_en: The third day of the workweek
back_cards.example_en: We have a meeting every Wednesday.
Wednesday is her yoga class day.
The sale starts this Wednesday.

The deadline is next Wednesday.
The study found a link between diet and health.
Click the link to visit the website.
The chain’s link was broken.
There’s a strong link between the two families.
The radio link kept the team in touch.
She deserves a promotion for her hard work.

back_cards.definition_en: To merit a reward or recognition
back_cards.example_en: He deserves praise for his honesty.

back_cards.definition_en: To be entitled to fair treatment
back_cards.example_en: Everyone deserves respect in the workplace.
They deserve a break after the long project.

back_cards.definition_en: To be suitable for an outcome
back_cards.example_en: His actions deserve careful consideration.
She is a famous singer around the world.
The town is famous for its historic castle.
He’s famous among scientists for his research.
This café is famous for its desserts.
Her famous speech inspired millions.

back_cards.definition_en: Action taken to improve a situation
back_cards.example_en: The intervention helped resolve the conflict.

Her intervention calmed the heated argument.
The grand castle stood on the hill.
They hosted a grand party for their anniversary.
The grand prize was a trip to Paris.
Her grand plan transformed the company.
The repair cost a grand total of $2,000.

back_cards.definition_en: To go see someone or a place
back_cards.example_en: She visited her friend in the hospital.

back_cards.definition_en: To travel to a location for leisure
back_cards.example_en: They visited Paris during their vacation.
The manager visited the new store location.
He visited his cousins for the weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: To access a website or resource
back_cards.example_en: Visit our site for more information.
Please confirm your appointment by email.
She confirmed the details of the contract.
The board confirmed his new position.

back_cards.definition_en: To affirm a belief or fact
back_cards.example_en: The test results confirmed her diagnosis.

back_cards.definition_en: To ensure a plan or booking
back_cards.example_en: He confirmed his flight for tomorrow.
She felt lucky to find a parking spot.

This is my lucky charm for exams.
Her lucky guess solved the puzzle.
They were lucky to escape the storm.
She insisted on paying for dinner.
He insisted that he was right.
They insisted we join the meeting.
She insisted on the importance of honesty.

back_cards.definition_en: To request firmly in a social context
back_cards.example_en: He insisted I try his homemade soup.

back_cards.definition_en: The land near the sea or ocean
back_cards.example_en: They walked along the coast at sunset.
The west coast is known for its beaches.
The car moved down the hill with a coast.
The east coast has many historic sites.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for relaxation or tourism
back_cards.example_en: Their vacation home is on the coast.
She was proud of her team’s victory.
He’s too proud to ask for help.
I’m proud of my sister’s courage.
The city has a proud history of innovation.
They were proud parents at the graduation.

back_cards.definition_en: To place something over or on top
back_cards.example_en: She covered the cake with frosting.
The insurance will cover the damages.
The news covered the event live.
The test covers chapters one to five.
He covered his mistake with a smile.

back_cards.definition_en: Coming after the third in order
back_cards.example_en: She finished in fourth place in the race.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to a sequence or list
back_cards.example_en: The fourth chapter is the most exciting.
He ate a fourth of the pizza.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to a specific event or date
back_cards.example_en: The fourth of July is a holiday.
This is my fourth attempt at the quiz.
The cop directed traffic at the intersection.
She thanked the cop for her help.

back_cards.definition_en: A term for authority in context
back_cards.example_en: The mall cop patrolled the stores.

back_cards.definition_en: A figure in a community setting
back_cards.example_en: The cop spoke at the school assembly.
Cops arrested the suspect last night.
He was angry about the delayed flight.
Her angry tone surprised her friends.

back_cards.definition_en: Showing upset in a personal context
back_cards.example_en: She felt angry when he ignored her.

back_cards.definition_en: The ball used in the sport

It’s expensive, but it’s worth it.

back_cards.definition_en: To indicate a change of thought

back_cards.definition_en: A contact method in daily life

back_cards.definition_en: A minor mishap in daily life

The front of the house needs painting.
She sat at the front of the classroom.
A cold front brought rain today.

back_cards.definition_en: The leading position in a group
back_cards.example_en: He’s at the front of the race.
It’s my duty to help my family.

back_cards.definition_en: A job or role in a profession
back_cards.example_en: He’s on duty at the hospital tonight.

back_cards.definition_en: A sense of loyalty or commitment
back_cards.example_en: She felt a duty to her country.
The growing plant needed more water.

His growing confidence impressed the team.

The company’s revenue grew this year.

The festival’s revenue supported charity.

back_cards.definition_en: To increase in size or scope
back_cards.example_en: The company plans to expand its stores.

They expanded their services to new cities.

back_cards.definition_en: The leader or head of a group
back_cards.example_en: The chief of the tribe made the decision.
The police chief addressed the community.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in charge of an organization
back_cards.example_en: She’s the chief of the marketing team.
He’s the chief architect of the project.

back_cards.definition_en: A respected authority in a field
back_cards.example_en: The chief scientist published a new study.

back_cards.definition_en: To start or set in motion
back_cards.example_en: They will launch the new product tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To send into the air or space
back_cards.example_en: The rocket will launch at dawn.

back_cards.definition_en: To begin a campaign or initiative
back_cards.example_en: The city launched a recycling program.
She launched her book with a signing event.

back_cards.definition_en: To start a business or venture
back_cards.example_en: He launched a startup in his garage.
The trend toward remote work is growing.
Bright colors are the latest trend.

back_cards.definition_en: A pattern in data or behavior
back_cards.example_en: The trend shows rising sales this year.
This hashtag is a trend on social media.
The trend is toward healthier eating.
She wore a diamond ring on her finger.
The tree’s ring showed its age.

back_cards.definition_en: A sound of a bell or phone
back_cards.example_en: The ring of the doorbell woke him up.
They uncovered a ring of thieves.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for events like boxing
back_cards.example_en: The boxer stepped into the ring.
Please repeat the instructions for me.

She took a deep breath before speaking.

Let’s take a breath and relax.

back_cards.definition_en: A hint or trace of something
back_cards.example_en: There wasn’t a breath of wind today.

back_cards.definition_en: A sign of life or energy
back_cards.example_en: Her breath was visible in the cold air.
The shelf is 12 inches wide.

The rain fell half an inch overnight.
The car inched forward in traffic.
The board was cut to the exact inch.

back_cards.definition_en: The part of the body connecting head and torso
back_cards.example_en: She wore a scarf around her neck.

back_cards.definition_en: A narrow part of an object
back_cards.example_en: The bottle’s neck was hard to clean.
They live in the neck of the woods.
The shirt’s neck was too tight.
It was a neck-and-neck race.

back_cards.definition_en: The central or most important part
back_cards.example_en: Teamwork is at the core of our success.
She removed the apple’s core before eating.

back_cards.definition_en: The essential part of a system
back_cards.example_en: The core of the software needs an update.

back_cards.definition_en: The inner part of the Earth
back_cards.example_en: Scientists study the Earth’s core.

It’s terrible that they lost their home.

It felt like a billion people were at the concert.

back_cards.definition_en: A quantity in statistics or data
back_cards.example_en: The population grew by a billion.

Her emotions were complex after the event.

The software uses complex algorithms.

back_cards.definition_en: To publish or report in media
back_cards.example_en: The newspaper will press the story tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: To fail to hit or catch
back_cards.example_en: He missed the ball during the game.

back_cards.definition_en: To feel the absence of someone
back_cards.example_en: She missed her family while away.

back_cards.definition_en: To fail to attend or experience
back_cards.example_en: I missed the concert due to work.

He missed the joke completely.

back_cards.definition_en: Moving or happening at a low speed

back_cards.definition_en: Not quick to learn or react

The machine generates electricity.

back_cards.definition_en: To produce as a result of effort
back_cards.example_en: They generated a detailed report.

Their friendship will last forever.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to a business or corporation

back_cards.definition_en: To like one thing over another

back_cards.definition_en: A high level of value or priority

back_cards.definition_en: Influence or weight in a context

back_cards.definition_en: A critical factor in daily life

back_cards.definition_en: A log of events or activities

back_cards.definition_en: The possibility of harm or injury

back_cards.definition_en: The joint between thigh and shin

Payments are made via the app.
The package arrived via express mail.

back_cards.definition_en: The time after noon until midnight
back_cards.example_en: The meeting is at 3 pm.
She goes jogging at 6 pm daily.
The store closes at 9 pm.
It’s 8 pm in New York now.

back_cards.definition_en: A time for work or events
back_cards.example_en: The webinar starts at 7 pm.
